intro: Borreria nana, commonly known as dwarf borreria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are often clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Borreria nana is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
